doc:
George Claydon https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Claydon 0 George Claydon (4 September 1933 – 4 October 2001) was a British actor notable for his dwarfism. His television roles included that of Photographer George in The Beatles' Magical Mystery Tour, a television film that initially aired on BBC1 on Boxing Day 1967, Ginaarbrik in the 1967 ITV adaptation of The Lion, the Witch and the Wardrobe (1967) (which he followed by playing Nikabrik many years later in the 1989 BBC adaptation of Prince Caspian), and the miniseries The Last Days of Pompeii (1984). His film appearances included the Joan Crawford horror film Berserk! (1967), as an Oompa Loompa in Willy Wonka the Chocolate Factory (1971), and as Hercules in I Don't Want to Be Born (1975). He was "World Cup Willie", the official mascot of the England Football Team in 1966. George_Claydon ( 4_September_1933 – 4_October_2001 ) was a_British_actor_notable for his_dwarfism . His_television_roles included that of Photographer_George in The_Beatles '_Magical_Mystery_Tour , a_television_film that initially_aired on BBC1 on Boxing_Day_1967 , Ginaarbrik in the_1967_ITV_adaptation of The_Lion , the_Witch and the_Wardrobe_(_1967_) ( which he followed by playing Nikabrik_many_years later in the_1989_BBC_adaptation of Prince_Caspian_) , and the_miniseries The_Last_Days of Pompeii_(_1984_) . His_film_appearances included the_Joan_Crawford_horror_film Berserk ! (_1967_) , as an_Oompa_Loompa in Willy_Wonka the_Chocolate_Factory ( 1971_) , and as Hercules in I Do_n't_Want_to_Be_Born (_1975_) . He was " World_Cup_Willie " , the_official_mascot of the_England_Football_Team in 1966 .
